For conservatives, it was pretty close to the best of times, and for liberals it was pretty close to the worst.

Although Roberts and Alito both promised that their confirmation hearings to honor precedent whenever possible, in their first full term together, they effectively reversed a number of key precedents - in each case, by a five-to-four vote.

On school desegregation, the court limited the ability of school boards to adopt voluntary desegregation plans that use race as a factor in assigning some students to schools.
